intro: Acmadenia psilopetala, commonly known as the slender-leaved acmadenia, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, narrow leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and inland regions. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
